questions.text: What is the name of the youth who fought a giant named Goliath in the Bible?
questions.explanation:
David.

	The people of Israel were scared of Goliath because he was a giant so no-one would fight him. David knew that with God's help, even little people could do big things, so using a sling shot and a stone David defeated Goliath.

questions.text: Which doctor has the ability to talk to animals?
questions.explanation:
Doctor Dolittle.

	Dr. Dolittle was played by Eddie Murphy in the remake movie.

questions.text: What does the "D" stand for in D.A.R.E.?
questions.explanation:
Drug.

	D.A.R.E is a program in America to educate children about the dangers of drugs and alcohol. D.A.R.E. stands for Drug Abuse Resistance Education.

questions.text: In "South Pacific" the children sing a song in French. What is the name of that song?
questions.explanation:
Dites-moi.

	Dites-moi translates into English as "Tell Me." The English translation of the song says: "Tell me why  life is beautiful. Tell me why, life is gay. Tell me why dear Ma'am. Is it because, you like me.?" This is the actual word for word translation, when it is song in English the words used are different, I'm guessing so it will fit within the tune without having to change it.

questions.text: Complete this line from Shakespeare's "Hamlet." "Something is rotten in the state of ________"
questions.explanation:
Denmark.

	Shakespeare had a son named Hamnet.

questions.text: Complete this quote said by Elaine on Seinfeld: "Maybe the _________ ate your baby."
questions.explanation:
dingo.

	I had to look up "dingo" in the dictionary after seeing this episode. According to www.dictionary.com a "dingo" is a wild Australian dog. This reference comes from a case in Australia where a woman's (Lindy Chamberlain) baby was missing. She was accused of killing her child. Years later they found proof that a dingo ate her baby.

questions.text: What is the Spanish word for "ten"?
questions.explanation:
diez.

	"Dix" is the French word for "ten". "Doce" is twelve in Spanish. "Decir" is the verb "to say" in Spanish.

questions.text: Who is the lawyer character in "True Grit"?
questions.explanation:
Dagget.

	Baby Sister says throughout the entire movie "My lawyer...J. Noble Dagget..."

questions.text: What is the French word for "ten"?
questions.explanation:
dix.

	"Diez" is the Spanish word for "ten". "Donner" is the French verb "to give". "Dites" is French for "you say"

questions.text: Who is the Roman goddess of the hunt and moon?
questions.explanation:
Diana.

	Diana is also the protectress of women.
